description: From Middle English turbulent, from Middle French turbulent, from Latin turbulentus, from turba (“disorder, tumult, crowd”).

adjectives.description: turbulent (comparative more turbulent, superlative most turbulent)

entries.meaning: violently disturbed or agitated; tempestuous, tumultuous
examples: It is dangerous to sail in turbulent seas.

entries.meaning: being in, or causing, disturbance or unrest
examples: The mid-19th century was a turbulent time in American history.
